result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph G Falkenstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consec to all jail sentences (cts 4 & 6 in 15CM1126 & ct 1 in 15CM1329)

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.
Psychological evaluation and treatment as recommended.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances or consume any alcohol without a valid prescription & permission of probation agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SG.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol. May not live anywhere there is alcohol.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
